author: Ben Nagle for MailOnline
title: Premier League dates 17-18: Season set to finish on May 13
text:
The Premier League has announced the 2017-18 season will run from August 12 to May 13.
The campaign will therefore conclude 32 days before the World Cup gets underway in Russia on June 14.
The end date means the league will finish a week earlier than this term. The current season is scheduled to finish on May 21.
In the 2017-18 season, the Premier League trophy will be lifted a week earlier on May 13
While players are set to get an earlier finish, there have been concerns raised about the festive period which could see some clubs play six times in 17 days.
In the current season, a maximum of four fixtures were played in the period between mid-December and the New Year, but that is set for an increase next term.
For some time, there have been calls for a winter break in English football to mirror the likes of Spain and Italy, and next season could increase those protests.
This season, Arsene Wenger was one of the managers especially critical, labelling the players' rest time as 'absolutely unbelievable'.
Jurgen Klopp's side played twice in 48 hours over the Christmas period, and he noted at the time: 'How do you prepare a team for this?'
Arsene Wenger has raised concerns about the potential of a hectic Christmas schedule
